page.title: 10RIVER TEES BRIDGES
page.content: The R.Tees runs roughly due east from Pennines to North Sea. Just to the south and roughly parallel, runs the A66, the busy trunk road linking north and west with south and east. Crossings of the river to gain access to the A66 at Middleton, Romaldkirk, Barnard Castle, Eggleston Abbey, Winston and Whorlton are all effected by bridges. The latter is a steel built suspension bridge with a weight limit of 3 tons, so it is closed to commercial traffic. The others are all stone bridges, built in the days of horses and todays heavy vehicles are ruining them. In the last two years every one has been closed for several months for urgent repairs. What is required is that one of them should be replaced by a modern bridge and road system to accommodate todays increasingly heavy traffic.
